definition: excess of internal heat due to poor general condition (TCM)/the prestige of another person, which one borrows for oneself
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
(of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
(TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
